intro: Pleiocarpa camerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon pleiocarpa, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
